snippet.textDisplay:
I never finished my DW VII copy on Playstation, and this game just looks so great. Gonna have to buy it. 

On the side, how does it compare to the Playstation version? I've looked into the DQ VIII that will be releasing at some point, and it doesn't look as immersive as the beautiful PS2 version did from what I've seen so far (I understand 3DS isn't the most powerful of handhelds)

snippet.textDisplay: I have been a dragon quest fan for over a decade, ever since dragon quest 7. I've played 5 and 6, and partially 4, but I have to say, I love 7 the most for its dungeons, its job classes, and the gameplay and story that comes with it.
snippet.textOriginal: I have been a dragon quest fan for over a decade, ever since dragon quest 7. I've played 5 and 6, and partially 4, but I have to say, I love 7 the most for its dungeons, its job classes, and the gameplay and story that comes with it.

snippet.textDisplay: Man I really got to play these games someday.  Any good starting games for a DQ newbie?  I do own a 3DS.

snippet.textDisplay: And the 3DS remake of VII is more accessible and demands less grinding. You won't have much trouble going through the game. But keep in mind the main quest takes up about 100 hours to finish.
snippet.textOriginal: And the 3DS remake of VII is more accessible and demands less grinding. You won't have much trouble going through the game. But keep in mind the main quest takes up about 100 hours to finish.

snippet.textDisplay: Any one of them are good places to start, I highly recommend V though.
snippet.textOriginal: Any one of them are good places to start, I highly recommend V though.

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks!!!
snippet.textOriginal: Thanks!!!

snippet.textDisplay:
Dragon quest 1 is always worth experiencing in all its simplicity, dragon quest IV is a good one, Dragon Quest VIII is user friendly and has most quality of life improvements. Dragon quest VII you get lost, angry and confused many times, but the game has the most customization of all DQ games (20 classes with mix and match skills and spells!!!) and has the most grinding too, as classes level by how many battles you have fought :P

All in all, Dragon quest III is a really good one to start from, as it is not too hard, has good systems (for its time) and the world is enjoyable. Altho some aspects are rather dated.
snippet.textOriginal:
Dragon quest 1 is always worth experiencing in all its simplicity, dragon quest IV is a good one, Dragon Quest VIII is user friendly and has most quality of life improvements. Dragon quest VII you get lost, angry and confused many times, but the game has the most customization of all DQ games (20 classes with mix and match skills and spells!!!) and has the most grinding too, as classes level by how many battles you have fought :P

All in all, Dragon quest III is a really good one to start from, as it is not too hard, has good systems (for its time) and the world is enjoyable. Altho some aspects are rather dated.

snippet.textDisplay: I always got lost in this damn game.  DQ3 and Swords were the best in the series in my opinion. I liked 9 but it required too much grinding at the end, similar to 8 after Dhoulmagus, though at least psyching up didn't have every boss after Dhoulmagus cast wave of ice. Ah well, encountered a tale of 2 games before with Final Fantasy 6, though world of ruin was better albeit ultima chaining may have been repetitive. Though I guess X-Fight undermines the hell out of most techs, and speaking of which, Cyan was too damn slow with his quadra slice or whatever taking 40 seconds, dunno how it is in later games.
snippet.textOriginal: I always got lost in this damn game.  DQ3 and Swords were the best in the series in my opinion. I liked 9 but it required too much grinding at the end, similar to 8 after Dhoulmagus, though at least psyching up didn't have every boss after Dhoulmagus cast wave of ice. Ah well, encountered a tale of 2 games before with Final Fantasy 6, though world of ruin was better albeit ultima chaining may have been repetitive. Though I guess X-Fight undermines the hell out of most techs, and speaking of which, Cyan was too damn slow with his quadra slice or whatever taking 40 seconds, dunno how it is in later games.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Mr. Variant It might help that I always have a dedicated Healer, never really played any RPG with jobs without a Priest/WhiteMage/Cleric etc.

Job switching was useful if I wanted a  Gladiator instead of Warrior, but unless you switched everyone at the same time, you could still "powerlevel" a level 1 by babysitting them in an area where they shouldn't be.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Mr. Variant It might help that I always have a dedicated Healer, never really played any RPG with jobs without a Priest/WhiteMage/Cleric etc.

snippet.textDisplay: Played two of the DS Dragon Quest games and #8 but it'll be my first time with DQVII very soon ^^

snippet.textDisplay: This is one thing I have to applaud Nintendo for: they stick to their western Dragon Quest fans. I never thought we would see this game here, or even VIII 3DS, but here we are! All of this despite bad DQVI DS sales and a huge localization needed for one of the biggest JRPGs ever. As someone who finished the original only a few years ago, I won't be playing this remake for a while, but it's one of my favorites in the series and I'll certainly buy it before it's too rare.
snippet.textOriginal: This is one thing I have to applaud Nintendo for: they stick to their western Dragon Quest fans. I never thought we would see this game here, or even VIII 3DS, but here we are! All of this despite bad DQVI DS sales and a huge localization needed for one of the biggest JRPGs ever. As someone who finished the original only a few years ago, I won't be playing this remake for a while, but it's one of my favorites in the series and I'll certainly buy it before it's too rare.

snippet.textOriginal: Now if they can only bring 11 3DS over

snippet.textDisplay: I have to very much agree, it warms my heart to see that they decided to release this game to the Western market. I was almost certain that they won't, seeing that they didn't have plans for it in the beginning. Likewise, I just finished the game actually couple of the days ago (the original), so I will take a break for a couple of years before I decide to play the remake, but  for what I saw I can already say for certain that it is what an every remake should be.
snippet.textOriginal: I have to very much agree, it warms my heart to see that they decided to release this game to the Western market. I was almost certain that they won't, seeing that they didn't have plans for it in the beginning. Likewise, I just finished the game actually couple of the days ago (the original), so I will take a break for a couple of years before I decide to play the remake, but  for what I saw I can already say for certain that it is what an every remake should be.

snippet.textDisplay: I actually wouldn't recommend VII as your first DQ because it's a huge game. I would recommend starting with a shorter but beloved iteration in the series. My personal recommendation would be the DS remakes of IV or V.
snippet.textOriginal: I actually wouldn't recommend VII as your first DQ because it's a huge game. I would recommend starting with a shorter but beloved iteration in the series. My personal recommendation would be the DS remakes of IV or V.

snippet.textDisplay: @OniLordMiki Really, the only major reasons I have to remake the game are that the DLC quests are impossible to get now that the network is shut down, and the multiplayer feature could be greatly revamped given the current advancement of technology. Otherwise, I totally agree. The game is already really amazing as it is. I just want it to get more love. Heck, Supra only has one track from the game in this list. That in and of itself is a crime.
snippet.textOriginal: @OniLordMiki Really, the only major reasons I have to remake the game are that the DLC quests are impossible to get now that the network is shut down, and the multiplayer feature could be greatly revamped given the current advancement of technology.
